N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8187-1.7 - Intervention by municipal corporations and participation by nonparties

State Regulations
(a) The hearing
officer, upon petition in writing and for good cause shown, may permit a
municipal corporation to intervene as a party in a proceeding conducted
pursuant to this Subpart, where such municipal corporation is not a named
respondent in the proceeding. A petition made pursuant to this subdivision
shall state with particularity: (1)
the
municipal corporation's relationship to the matters involved in the
proceeding; (2)
the nature of the
evidence and argument the municipal corporation intends to present; and
(3)
the specific reasons why
intervention should be permitted. (b) Any individual or corporation, who is
interested in a proceeding conducted to this Subpart, may submit to the hearing
officer a signed, written statement or memorandum of law setting forth: (1)
the name of the individual or
corporation; (2)
the nature of the
interest in the proceeding; and
(3)
proposed recommendations, if any. (c) ORPTS and any respondent shall be
simultaneously provided with a copy of any submission made pursuant to
subdivision (b) of this section and shall be afforded a reasonable opportunity
to offer response or comment. Notes
